meanings.definition: To persuade or try to persuade by flattery or smooth words.
meanings.sent1: She wheedles her brother into sharing his toys with her.
meanings.sent2: He always wheedles his way into getting what he wants.
meanings.sent3: The cat wheedles the treat out of its owner with a cute meow.
meanings.sent4: The salesman wheedles the customer into buying the expensive watch.
meanings.sent5: Her sweet smile and kind words can wheedle anyone into helping her.

meanings.definition: To influence or entice by soft words or flattery.
meanings.sent1: The child wheedles his parents for a new toy.
meanings.sent2: She wheedles her friends into joining her for a movie night.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wheedles its way into sleeping on the bed with its adorable eyes.
meanings.sent4: The politician wheedles the voters with promises of a better future.
meanings.sent5: His charming personality can wheedle even the toughest critics.

meanings.definition: To coax or persuade someone to do something through flattery or trickery.
meanings.sent1: He wheedles his sister into doing his chores for him.
meanings.sent2: She wheedles her boss into giving her a day off.
meanings.sent3: The magician wheedles the audience into believing his tricks are real.
meanings.sent4: The fox wheedles the crow into dropping the cheese with clever words.
meanings.sent5: The child wheedles his way into getting extra dessert by complimenting the chef.
